div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 751px; margin-left: 698px;

div.div:
Publishes merkle roots for each
batch of events to the blockchain.

div.div:
Inter registry transactions invokes
actions between registries.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 238px; height: 1px; padding-top: 770px; margin-left: 811px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.div: [External system]

font.font: Conventional blockchain that will store a series of hashes for each merkle tree, ensuring that data within the tree cannot be changed without it being visible.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 238px; height: 1px; padding-top: 550px; margin-left: 811px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;

div.div: [External system]

font.font: Other registries that supports the same protocol, enabled cross registry claims.

font.font: Concept of accounts, users and holdings, manages public-private key pairs.

and request merkle-proofs

font.font: Stores events as public data, and arranges them in a series of merkle trees, each root publishes to the blockchain after a set time or number of events.

privacy
and
commitments
, by enabling requests signed with correct keys to create events and unlock data in commitments.
